headline.main: Goals by Perisic and Brozovic Help Croatia Sink Israel
headline.print_headline: Goals by Perisic and Brozovic Help Croatia Sink Israel

docs.snippet: Goals by Ivan Perisic and Marcelo Brozovic earned hosts Croatia a 2-0 friendly win over Israel in Osijek on Wednesday in a free-flowing match containing several missed chances....
docs.lead_paragraph: Goals by Ivan Perisic and Marcelo Brozovic earned hosts Croatia a 2-0 friendly win over Israel in Osijek on Wednesday in a free-flowing match containing several missed chances.

headline.main: Honduras Arrests U.S. Woman for Alleged Leadership Role in Gang
headline.print_headline: Honduras Arrests U.S. Woman for Alleged Leadership Role in Gang

docs.snippet: A 21-year-old American woman was detained in Honduras, authorities said on Wednesday, for allegedly heading a faction of the Mara Barrio 18, one of the gangs responsible for a crime wave in the Central American nation that has sent families flocki...
docs.lead_paragraph: A 21-year-old American woman was detained in Honduras, authorities said on Wednesday, for allegedly heading a faction of the Mara Barrio 18, one of the gangs responsible for a crime wave in the Central American nation that has sent families flocking to the United States seeking refuge.

headline.main: Solar Incentives Sunset as States Grapple With Tight Budgets
headline.print_headline: Solar Incentives Sunset as States Grapple With Tight Budgets

docs.snippet: Thousands of homeowners and small businesses in New Mexico — the second sunniest state in the nation — have invested nearly a quarter billion dollars in roof-top solar and related labor thanks to a program fueled by tax credits....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of homeowners and small businesses in New Mexico — the second sunniest state in the nation — have invested nearly a quarter billion dollars in roof-top solar and related labor thanks to a program fueled by tax credits.

headline.main: Regulator Approves Exelon's Takeover of Pepco
headline.print_headline: Regulator Approves Exelon's Takeover of Pepco

docs.snippet: A Washington, D.C., regulator approved Exelon's nearly $7 billion takeover of rival utility Pepco, but the deal will only go through if Exelon agrees to the regulator's terms....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Washington, D.C., regulator approved Exelon's nearly $7 billion takeover of rival utility Pepco, but the deal will only go through if Exelon agrees to the regulator's terms.

headline.main: Slovak President Appoints Robert Fico for Another Term as PM
headline.print_headline: Slovak President Appoints Robert Fico for Another Term as PM

docs.snippet: Slovak president Andrej Kiska appointed Robert Fico as prime minister on Wednesday after Fico's leftist Smer party won the largest share of the vote in a March 5 election and formed a four-party coalition....
docs.lead_paragraph: Slovak president Andrej Kiska appointed Robert Fico as prime minister on Wednesday after Fico's leftist Smer party won the largest share of the vote in a March 5 election and formed a four-party coalition.

headline.main: Clinton: More Europe Can Do to Help U.S. Combat Terrorism
headline.print_headline: Clinton: More Europe Can Do to Help U.S. Combat Terrorism

docs.snippet: Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton said on Wednesday the attack in Brussels that killed more than 30 people is the "latest brutal reminder" that more must be done to defeat Islamic State militants, including by European Union mem...
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential front-runner Hillary Clinton said on Wednesday the attack in Brussels that killed more than 30 people is the "latest brutal reminder" that more must be done to defeat Islamic State militants, including by European Union member countries.
